oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Carolina Country Style: Hosted by Doug Mayes: Tape 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is of a vairety of interviews performed by Doug Mayes (host/personaility) for WBT's Carolina Country Style radio program. The tape features interviews of Grandpa Jones (entertainer), Jimmy Martin (entertainer), Mrs. Guthrie (personality), Vaughan Horton (entertainer), Dave Dudley (entertainer), Loretta Lynn (entertainer), Dottie West (entertainer), Minnie Pearl (entertainer), Lester Flatt and Earl Scruggs (musical group), Del Reeves (entertainer), and Billy Walker (entertainer). Recordings are from a variety of unknown dates. The tape is the second of six tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Doug Mayes; Del Reeves; Grandpa Jones; Jimmy Martin; Vaughan Horton; Dave Dudley; Loretta Lynn; Dottie West; Minnie Pearl; Flatt and Scruggs; Del Reeves; Billy Walker
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:04) Doug Mayes introduces Grandpa Jones; additionally, both discuss how a number of entertainers got their beginnings -- (06:34) Mayes introduces Jimmy Martin, and both discuss the growing respect for country music and Martin -- (13:41) Mayes introduces Mrs. Guthrie, and both reflect on Guthrie's family's influence on Tom Tall -- (17:36) Mayes introduces Vaughan Horton; additionally, Mayes asks for Horton's introspection to the success of "Mockingbird Hill" -- (25:46) Mayes introduces Dave Dudley, and Mayes invites Dudley to reflect on the organization of his road show -- (30:04) Mayes introduces Loretta Lynn, and Lynn is asked to revel in the success that lead to her receiving the Female Artist of the Year Award -- (36:27) Mayes and Dottie West reflect on how she recorded "Here Comes My Baby" and how West met Bill West -- (42:40) Mayes has West introduce "In its Own Little Way, My Heart Keeps Loving You" -- (43:12) Mayes praises Minnie Pearl; additionally, both reflect on Pearl's vision of egotistical people -- (47:37) Mayes introduces Lester Flatt and Earl Scruggs, and Flatt and Scruggs account for their long successes -- (53:34) Mayes introduces Del Reeves, and both express their ideas of the growth in recording processes -- (57:38) Mayes introduces Billy Walker, additionally, Mayes inquires about Walker's opinion on having a good support system
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mayes, Doug; Reeves, Del; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Martin, Jimmy; Horton, Vaughn, 1911-1988; Dudley, Dave; Lynn, Loretta; Lynn, Loretta, 1932-; West, Dottie, 1932-1991; Pearl, Minnie; Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys (Musical group); Reeves, Del; Walker, Billy, 1929-2006;
